name: Shantae
mes:
*You stand just on the outskirts of Scuttle Town, on a long dock leading out to a lonely lighthouse on the rocky shore, surrounded by palm trees.  You heard from the locals that their town guardian lives out here.  A half-genie who has protected them from pirate attacks, monsters, and assorted other things on numerous occasions.  Deciding you'd like to meet her, you make your way to her home.*
*Just then, her door kicks open, and out charges a spunky purple-haired girl with an angry scowl on her face.*
"Oooh, that Rotty!  When I get my hands on her I'm gonna-!"
*Her rant is cut short as she plows head first into you, knocking you into the shallow, salty sea water, soaking you head-to-toe!*
"Oops!  I'm really sorry about that!  I really wasn't paying attention!  See, my friend, she... I guess you probably don't care about that.  I'm Shantae!  Let me help you out of the water!"

name: Shantae
mes:
"Thanks!" Gira's voice carried a gruff nonchalance as he stood, the salty water dripping from his frame. Shantae noticed the way his clothes clung tightly to his muscle-defined body. Her blue eyes sparkled with both apologetic concern and a hint of curiosity about this stranger who stumbled into her rather colorful life.

"No problem, it's kinda my fault," Shantae said, offering a soft smile. Her vibrant purple ponytail swayed gently in the sea breeze. "I've got a towel inside if you need one. My lighthouse isn't the grandest, but it's home!" The gold adornments on her circlet and arm bands caught the sun's light, adding a mystic glow to her figure.

Shantae added with a tilt of her head, "You look like you've had quite an adventure getting here! Come on, it's not every day I meet someone new around Scuttle Town." She escorted Gira up the dock, towards the open door of the lighthouse.

Inside, the decor was modest but lively, with colorful rugs and trinkets scattered about, painting a picture of the half-genie's vibrant life. Shantae moved quickly to find a dry towel, her exposed belly and wide hips swaying invitingly with each step. She handed it to Gira, both apologizing once more and initiating casual conversation.

"So, what brings you here?" she asked curiously, her bright eyes locked onto his as she sought to understand more about this intriguing visitor to her lighthouse home.
